Hi Sarah-Jane,

To answer your question, you can send us the images and we'll resize them on our end. What we did right now is we made some adjustments with the codes on your site to display thumbnails on the gallery using the images you uploaded. The layout is fixed now however, due to the image's size, it is a bit blurry.

Hi there,

I asked the photographer to send through the web-ready ones and they were all very large i.e. 1-3MB, so I had to resize all of them in photoshop. However, I think if I made them 400x400 or more the overall image was larger than 200kb and I've been told to keep it below that otherwise the page will load too slow.

I had to keep shrinking the pixels to reduce the kb below 200 - what should I do here?

Kindest Regards,

Sarah-Jane Lamont

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Pending

full_threads.body:
Hi Sarah-Jane,

I was able to replicate the gallery issue when I went to the mentioned case study page. I've checked it and found that it is because of the image sizes. The images should be at least 400 by 400 for WordPress to generate its thumbnail to display. If not, it will display the full image, which may distort the gallery's layout, as you can see. Would you like us to resize the images for you? 

Please let us know.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Glen Tenorio
Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Rica Rosario Valencia
